definition: lightning speed/amazingly rapid/incredible pace of development
lit. speed is a crucial asset in war (idiom)/fig. swift and resolute (in doing sth)

sentences.english: It is important that he improves very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 他的进步非常神速，这点很重要。

sentences.english: Of these, Poland was praised for making rapid progress through school reform.
sentences.chinese: 其中，波兰因学校改革而进步神速，备受夸赞。

sentences.english: The military action request gets there first, rapid reaction.
sentences.chinese: 军事行动要求兵贵神速，快速反应。

sentences.english: The result is a lightning-fast page load.
sentences.chinese: 最后的结果是一个加载神速的页面。

sentences.english: Advances in many fields are being made so fast these days that it is impossible for textbooks to keep up.
sentences.chinese: 目前许多领域都时步神速，教科书根本不可能跟得上。

sentences.english: In “shadow boxing mode” Atom mimics his coach’s movements with lightning speed.
sentences.chinese: 在“影子模仿模式”下，亚当能神速模仿教练的动作。

sentences.english: A successful non-match is significantly faster.
sentences.chinese: 成功的非匹配相当神速。

sentences.english: Such alarming reports have not slowed the huge expansion of the industry.
sentences.chinese: 这种警钟并没有减缓抗衰老业的神速发展。

sentences.english: Fleet-footed and frugal Chinese firms are coming up with business-model innovations too.
sentences.chinese: 神速而节俭的中国公司正在提出商业模式创新。

sentences.english: Doris' French improved by leaps and bounds after she got a French boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 在交了一个法籍男友之后，桃乐丝的法语进步神速。

sentences.english: Compared with nearly all the previous extinctions this would be fast-track.
sentences.chinese: 与之前的五次相比，这次物种灭绝可谓神速。

sentences.english: Mr. Curtis’s career advanced rapidly at first.
sentences.chinese: 柯蒂斯的事业一开始就进展神速。

sentences.english: Have you finished your composition already? You're very speedy.
sentences.chinese: 你已经写完作文了吧？你是很神速的。

sentences.english: He learned so rapidly he brought smiles to the face of his master.
sentences.chinese: 果真进步神速，他带着微笑去见了自己的师父。

definition: lit. one day, a thousand miles (idiom); rapid progress
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
at top speed/at a tremendous lick
to advance by leaps and bounds
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
